Some guests may have dietary restrictions or allergies, making it challenging to accommodate their needs while still providing a delicious meal for everyone.
The kitchen may not be large enough to accommodate all the necessary cooking and serving equipment, leading toiety and overcrowding.
There may not be enough seating for everyone, leading toiety and discomfort during the meal.
The cost of purchasing and preparing the food and drinks for a large family can be prohibitive, leading to financial strain.
There may not be enough time to prepare and cook all the dishes before the guests arrive, leading to rushed and undercooked food.
